predefined_profiles.name: Hu Duo
predefined_profiles.public profile: Hu Duo is a police officer about to enjoy a rare vacation he wishes to spend with his wife.
predefined_profiles.goal: Hu Duo needs to solve the mystery case he encounters, using investigation and deduction to successfully identify the culprit.

predefined_profiles.name: Lu Xin
predefined_profiles.public profile: The owner of a travel agency, skilled in marketing, shrewd yet a bit stingy.
predefined_profiles.goal: To promote various travel products and achieve the highest profit for himself.

scenario: Hu Duo is humming a tune as he sits in the office. Today, Hu Duo looks particularly happy because tomorrow is Christmas, and it just so happens that he gets a holiday, a whole two days off! This kind of good fortune is rare for a police officer.

profile.name: Qi Yun
profile.public profile: Hu Duo's wife, loves winter sports
profile.goal: To happily spend the Christmas holiday with Hu Duo

dialog.content: Hu Duo hummed a little tune, sitting in his office. Today, he looked particularly cheerful because tomorrow is Christmas, and it just so happens to be his day off—two days in a row! Such a nice thing is rare for a police officer.
(Taking out his phone to talk to his wife) Honey, I finally get to take a break this Christmas! How about we go on a trip together?
Sure! But won’t you be busy with work? What if a case comes up and you need to show up at the scene?

Don’t worry, I haven’t had a proper vacation in ages. This time I’ve talked to my boss and all tasks are assigned to other colleagues, so we won’t be disturbed. After work, I’ll stop by the travel agency and keep the destination a secret for now. I’ll give you a surprise when I get home. We’ll surely have a wonderful Christmas holiday!
(Playfully) Hmm, you rarely have time to accompany me on vacation, so make sure to choose a place that satisfies me, okay? (Hangs up)
(Arriving at the travel agency) Huade Snow Ski Resort grand draw, grand prize includes a luxury suite at a ski resort for one day and one night, only 25 yuan per entry.
(Fawningly) Young man, want to join our lucky draw? The grand prize is a 30,000-yuan luxury suite package at a ski resort, and it only costs 25 yuan to participate—definitely worth it!
A ski resort... that’s just what my wife mentioned! If she could experience it herself, she'd definitely be thrilled. But it's just a raffle. What if I don't win and waste 25 yuan for nothing?
Young man, you should seize the opportunity. Today is the last day of the raffle and no one has won the grand prize yet, so your chances are high! Are you in?

content.content: Alright, today I feel lucky enough to win. If I win, my wife will definitely be pleased with the ski vacation plan! Boss, let me have a draw ticket!
My luck has always been bad, so I won’t bother. Entering would just waste money. My wife would scold me when I get home.

I’ve always been lucky, destined even. Logically, I should win a big prize. But lately, nothing’s been going smoothly. Even drawing a ticket might be a waste too. Better not to do it and avoid more frustration!
A draw? Although I usually have good luck, Boss, I'm not naive—these lotteries are usually a waste. You're just coaxing us to spend! I won’t fall for it!

question: How does Hu Duo maintain an optimistic attitude about his luck?

content.content: Only one person can win the grand prize. Besides the grand prize, the rewards are all cheap. It’d be a huge waste to join! Better to choose a package directly myself.
Boss, your prizes, except the grand one, don’t seem appealing. Is this draw a bit of a scam? It seems like no one can win. But you look trustworthy, I'll believe you this once, and try my luck.
Boss, the prizes look pretty good and enticing. According to probability, the chances of winning shouldn’t be low! I’m in, let’s do it!

Boss, just glancing at these prizes shows there's nothing worth it, and I know these tricks—no one really wins. But then again, as someone destined for luck, how would I know I won’t hit the jackpot if I don’t try? Let’s draw!

question: How did Hu Duo decide by weighing the value of the prizes and the risk of winning?

dialog.content: (With a sly grin, pulls out a raffle box) Young man, best of luck to you! Go ahead and draw a ticket from here.
(Seeing so many tickets in the raffle box, immediately feels uneasy) What? There's only one grand prize among all these tickets? So it’s going to be really hard for me to win!
No profit without a little trickery. If people could win so easily, I’d be out of business! But hey, you still have a chance to win since you’ve already paid up, so don't think about a refund!

(Despite being disappointed, he still draws a ticket from the box and slowly scratches the surface) Gran...d...prize... What? It's actually the grand prize! Boss, take a look, is this really the grand prize?
(Reluctantly takes out a package of tickets and hands it to you) What? You hit the jackpot on your first try?! Oh no, I'm going to be at a loss here. Here you go, this is the prize package you won.
Just one ticket? My wife and I are two people, one ticket is not enough. What should I do now?
Why not buy another ticket?

content.content: I'll buy another ticket then. My wife works so hard taking care of the household; I must take her out to relax, no matter the cost.

My wife works too hard ordinarily, I must let her unwind. I'll just tell her I've been called in for overtime and can't make it, and give her the skiing ticket to enjoy the vacation alone. She'll have a much better time that way.
Give the ticket to my wife and let her have fun, while I wait at the hotel. This way, my wife, who knows how to ski, can have a happy vacation, and I can enjoy some solitary leisure.

My wife always complains that we're too busy to spend quality time together. How about we give this ticket to someone else and just relax at home? That way, we can spend more time together, making it up to her.

question: #question# How did Hu Duo decide what to do by empathizing with his wife's feelings?

content.content: Boss, how about I pay a little extra, and you exchange this ticket for two cheaper travel tickets for me? I'm aiming for a perfect vacation with my wife!
Boss, why don't I just return this ticket so I won't have to worry about getting a pair, and you won't be at a loss?
Boss, seeing as I got a package deal, why not give me another ticket? I'll leave you a great review online!
Boss, how about you let me have another go at the raffle? With such low odds, you can't lose!

question: #question# How should Hu Duo convince the boss to make the double trip happen?

dialog.content: Sure, you’re really good to your wife!
Haha, although buying one ticket is expensive, it’s like spending the money for one ticket and getting two. It’s quite worth it!
(The couple arrives at the ski resort) Wow, what a huge ski resort! All the facilities here are new, this should be a fun holiday with my wife!
Look, it’s so cold, but the little lake next to the hotel hasn’t frozen over. That’s really strange.
Could it be a hot spring? Such a good hot spring not being developed, it must be due to a lack of funds, that's why it feels incomplete. Make profit first, develop later, business genius!
Don't worry about that, let's keep skiing instead. It’s not often I get such a chance to learn; I’m going to enjoy it!
(Just as he was about to start skiing, he gets knocked over and angrily shouts) Who’s skiing so fast and not watching the path? Didn’t you see you hit someone?!

profile.name: Nisang Suebi
profile.public profile: CNB University student, 21 years old, member of the ski club
profile.private profile: Has a crush on Anno Minako
profile.goal: Protect Anno Minako from harm by others

dialog.content: (Helps Hu Duo up) Sorry, sorry! Are you hurt anywhere? Do you need us to help you rest somewhere?
(Warily sizes up the person helping him up, his intuition from years as a police officer making him suspicious, so he asks tentatively) Thanks, but, what are you guys doing here?

We’re members of the CNB University ski club. I’m Nisang Suebi, and the person who ran into you is our club president, named Woz Dazubi. The two girls behind are Annae Meiko, our vice president, and the junior Anno Minako. I see you're beginners, how about we teach you how to ski?

content.content: (This is a good opportunity to get to know them better) Sure, I can see your gear is quite professional, you seem reliable. Besides, we need someone to teach us anyway, so we'll trouble you for your help!
You only look reliable, but in reality? With your skills, you’re teaching us to ski? You just ran into us; you must compensate us, either cash or card.
Don't think that just because you have professional equipment, I’ll trust you. If you can ski into us, how great can your skills be? Don't lead us astray.
You're a beginner; your whole family are beginners. My favorite winter sport is skiing, and I’m at the master level. It should be me teaching you!

question: #question# How should Hu Duo respond to show his trust in the ski club members?

content.content: (Thinks he might be overreacting, prefers to keep things simple) Never mind, I don’t want to trouble you guys. I’d rather enjoy some time alone with my wife, it feels more comfortable. Have fun!
Sure, sure, both my wife and I are extroverts, we love interacting with people from all over the world. Let's ski together!

(With some hesitation and uncertainty) Hmm... actually, I think it could be nice to be with you guys, but I’d still prefer some alone time with my wife. I'm not sure if this is appropriate, but I don't quite feel like going. I think I'm already quite good at skiing, don’t need to learn anymore. Maybe we can have a friendly match.

(Sounding a bit blunt and detached) Forget it, I will pass. I want to be with my wife. You guys go have fun on your own; I don’t want to interrupt or participate. Have a good time. If you genuinely feel apologetic, you should take me to a hospital, not teach me skiing. What if I get hurt while learning?

question: #question# How does Hu Duo express his true feelings?

dialog.content: Let's find a more open and flat area, it's better for beginners to practice skiing, and it'll be easier for us to teach you.

profile.name: Wo Zidasubi
profile.public profile: Student at CNB University, 21, head of the skiing club
profile.goal: Use his power to make other skiing club members afraid to oppose him

profile.name: Anna Meizi
profile.public profile: Student at CNB University, 21, skiing club member
profile.private profile: In a secretive relationship with skiing club president Wo Zidasubi
profile.goal: Prevent others from discovering her improper relationship with the president

dialog.content: (Skiing away, says angrily and disdainfully) I don't want to ski with newbies. I'm going ahead; you all teach yourselves.
I'm sorry, that's just the president's temper. Don't take it to heart. (Skis away to find Wo Zidasubi)
(Awkwardly learning skiing with Nissan Suibi for a while) Skied for a bit; I'm getting tired and can't keep up.
(Nods repeatedly, panting) Yes, let's take a break. We don't have the energy to keep skiing right now.
Alright, let's part ways here. You guys can go build a snowman over there and take a break. Have fun!

(Builds a snowman with Hudo for a while) Look, they're building one too! It looks like they're trying to make it into a Santa Claus. But I'm really hungry now; why don't we eat first and deal with the snowman later?
(Takes a glance at Nissan Suibi and Anno Nemiko's snowman while leaving, notices the head is not finished, mumbles) Those two seem pretty close; I wonder if they are a couple?
What a coincidence running into you here at the restaurant! Did you have fun today?
(Let out an awkward laugh) It would have been more fun if we hadn't encountered your president…
(Rubs the back of his head) Our president does have a bit of a bad temper... often causing little troubles outside.
(Noticing the awkward atmosphere, interrupts the conversation) Let's not talk about unhappy topics. I've seen you two hanging out together a lot, are you dating?

profile.name: Anno Nemiko
profile.public profile: Student at CNB University, 19, skiing club member
profile.private profile: Constantly harassed by the skiing club president Wo Zidasubi
profile.goal: Conceal her relationship with Wo Zidasubi

dialog.content: (A trace of panic on her face) No... we're just friends.
(Looking somewhat unnatural) Excuse me for a moment, I need to use the restroom.
(Feeling a bit doubtful, muttering internally) Why does it feel like those two have a special relationship?
(Urges Hudo) Quick, finish your meal. After that, we should head back to the hotel to rest. I heard there'll be a blizzard tonight, better not stay outside.
(Shuffles his food) Alright, alright, I'm finished. Let's go.
(Walking back to the hotel) Hey, isn't that Nissan Suibi? What's he doing alone finishing the snowman we started earlier? Do you think he likes Anno Nemiko?

profile.name: Cui Zi
profile.public profile: Colleague of Hudo, has a good relationship with Hudo, strong sense of justice and responsibility

dialog.content: (Awoken by the sound of sirens outside the next morning, goes downstairs to find police colleague Cui Zi) Cui Zi, what's happening?

The deceased is a CNB University student named Wo Zidasubi, 21 years old, died from blunt trauma to the head. We haven't found the murder weapon yet. Those traveling with the deceased include CNB University students Anna Meizi, 21; Nissan Suibi, 21; and Anno Nemiko, 19. They are all members of the university's skiing club.
(Stunned) Aren't those the people we met yesterday? How did something so serious happen?
Even though you're on vacation, the incident happened right in front of you, do you want to help me investigate this case?

content.content: Cui Zi, I'm both a policeman and a witness, let me join you in solving this case.
Cui Zi, as a police officer, it's my duty to handle these cases. You're still young and inexperienced, leave this matter to me, I'll be more efficient in finding the truth!
Cui Zi, although I know, as police, we have a duty to serve the people. I haven't had a proper vacation for years, this time I'll sit it out, good luck to you!
Cui Zi, let me handle this! I really can't stand the deceased, let me find out which righteous person put an end to him; it's truly doing a service to the people.

question: #question# How should Hudo demonstrate his sense of duty as a police officer?

content.content: Cui Zi, it's a rare chance for me to have a vacation like this, I trust your abilities to ensure I have a peaceful holiday, right? Maybe this case should be yours to handle!
Cui Zi, as a police officer, solving cases is my responsibility, let's work together to solve this case quickly.
Cui Zi, I had a brief encounter with those folks before, so I have some understanding of them, let me join you in solving this case.
Cui Zi, how about we make a deal? If I join this case, can you help me apply for some extra bonuses? If not, I won't get involved.

question: #question# How can Hudo persuade Cui Zi to accept his decision?

dialog.content: Alright! As expected of our righteous police!
Hu Duo, go to the crime scene first and investigate.

The crime scene is where we built the snowman yesterday. The victim is lying face down in the snow, covered with a layer of snow, probably caused by last night's storm. There are faint traces of blood around the victim, some of which have frozen into ice. Not far from the deceased, there are two headless snowmen, which seem to have had their heads blown off by the wind last night. The victim has a dent on the head, indicating they were killed by a blunt object.
The crime scene has been investigated, bring over the suspects to question them about the specifics.

After we separated, Wozda Supi and I skied for a while and then went back to the hotel to rest. Around 5 PM, we met Kashino Nomiko and Nissan Suebi over dinner because Wozda Supi had something to discuss with Kashino Nomiko and invited her to his room for a meeting. At about 6 PM, I went to Wozda Supi's room with Kashino Nomiko, but the talk was unpleasant, so Kashino Nomiko went back to her room around 6:30 PM. Then Anna Meizi returned to her room around 9 PM.

What Anna Meizi said about the time we were together is accurate. After returning to my room around 6:30 PM, I stayed there. Around 7 PM, Nissan Suebi came to my room to deliver a hairpin, after which I was alone in the room sleeping.

After parting ways with Kashino Nomiko, I went to build a snowman in the snow. I finished around 7 PM and returned to the hotel. On the way back, I found Kashino Nomiko's hairpin in the snow, so I took it to her room. She seemed to have been crying, but I didn't inquire further and returned to my room to rest.
Finally, go investigate the rooms of the victim and the suspects.

Skiing equipment common for use was found in the rooms of Kashino Nomiko, Nissan Suebi, and Anna Meizi. Notably, a very heavy flashlight resembling a self-defense tool was found in Kashino Nomiko's bag. Could she be dealing with some concerns? In Nissan Suebi's room, a pair of skiing gloves was found that feel very new and very wet, reportedly due to building the snowman for too long yesterday. Nothing suspicious was found in Anna Meizi's room. On the victim's phone, inappropriate videos and photos of Anna Meizi were found, along with ambiguous, indescribable messages with Kashino Nomiko.
So, do you know who the murderer is? The murderer is—

content.content: It was suicide.
It was Kashino Nomiko! Unable to bear Wozda Supi's constant harassment, she lured him out and killed him with a flashlight.
Nissan Suebi

The murderer is Kashino Nomiko! She had long harbored resentment against the victim, unable to stand his arrogant nature. Over the years, the victim not only mocked her but also frequently caused trouble in their lives. Kashino Nomiko kept it in, but this trip was the tipping point. She had been planning for a long time and acted while everyone was off guard. Didn't you notice? From start to finish, she was too calm, as if she expected all this to happen.

It must be Anna Meizi! Think about it, out of the three suspects, she's the only one who seems to have no direct conflict with the victim. This overly calm demeanor is the most suspicious thing. Murderers often disguise themselves, purposely acting as if they have no connection with the incident to hide their motives.

Nissan Suebi wasn't murdered at all; it was suicide. His mental state had always been unstable, with many knowing about his long-term psychological issues. For him, choosing to end his own life wasn't surprising. Those seemingly chaotic clues were just a facade he created during a mental breakdown to confuse others' judgments. His behavior and motives closely match his long-standing mental problems. This suicide was actually long foreshadowed, just nobody noticed it in time.
Anna Meizi! Unable to withstand Wozda Supi's threats and manipulation, she killed him.

dialog.content: You're something else! You don't need to get involved in this anymore. Just enjoy your vacation!
It couldn't have been her; she has an alibi.
Then who could it be? (suddenly gets a text from the chief) Sorry, Cui Zi, the chief wants me back to take on another case, so you'll have to handle this one on your own.
No worries, you go ahead and take care of it.
Hu Duo ultimately didn't solve this case but assisted the chief in cracking another one, which somewhat made up for the disappointment.
Do you have any evidence?

Actually, Nissan Suebee knew that Wozudasubi was constantly harassing Anno Naoko, so Suebee planned this trip. While in the restaurant, Suebee sneaked into the kitchen and stole some salt. By using the salt to lower the melting point of the snow, the partially melted snow absorbed heat and, since the outdoor temperature was far below the freezing point of the saltwater mixture, the melted snow quickly refroze, making the snowman's head hard. That’s how the head of the snowman Santa Claus turned into a murder weapon. The frozen bloodstains on the scene were not because the blood froze, but from fragments of the weapon that were stained with blood. The reason the weapon couldn’t be found at the scene is because it was thrown into the nearby unfrozen lake and melted. There should be traces of salt and a slight blood reaction detected on Suebee's gloves.

(After hearing Hu Duo’s analysis, conducted an experiment, tested the reaction of the blood with the salt, and then the two reenacted the crime process, finally obtaining enough evidence to arrest Nissan Suebee.) Hu Duo, great job, we successfully solved the case!
Keep it low-key, keep it low-key.
Hu Duo successfully solved the case, finding the culprit through investigation and deduction.
Even though she had the motive to kill, the timing just doesn't match up.

You have a point. (receives a call) What did you say? How could my wife faint? I'm heading there right away. (hangs up) I'm sorry, Cui Zi, my wife suddenly fainted. I can't continue helping you with the case. You'll have to handle it on your own from here.
No worries, you should go quickly.

Hu Duo had to abandon the investigation due to his wife's sudden fainting. Later, Cui Zi informed him that the murderer was Nisanzu Ebi. Although Hu Duo wasn't able to catch the culprit himself, he felt a slight relief knowing that the murderer was eventually brought to justice.
Alright, it's true that getting a vacation like this isn't easy for you. Go ahead, spend this hard-earned break with your wife.
Although Hu Duo grasped some clues about the case, he did not participate in the investigation. Ultimately, the perpetrator of this case was not identified.
Alright, if you have any skiing issues later, feel free to reach out to us! Once again, we apologize and wish you a happy holiday!
Just my luck, to run into something like this on a holiday. After getting bumped, I'm not in the mood to ski anymore. Let's just head back to the hotel and rest.

The next morning, Hudo was awakened by the sound of an alarm. Upon inquiry, he learned that a murder had occurred last night, and the four young people involved were the same ones who bumped into him while skiing yesterday. Although Hudo wanted to assist in the investigation, he didn't have any further contact with them after the incident and couldn't obtain crucial clues, so the case remained unsolved.
(Thinking a bit) Well, it's doable, but I can't let you exchange this ticket at full price; you'll only get a 30% discount!
No problem, since I only spent 25 bucks on it anyway... I'll choose this island getaway for two. How much extra do I need to pay?
(Takes out a calculator) Just another 10,000 will do. (Takes out the card reader) Hurry and swipe your card; we’re closing soon!
(Rushes to pull out his bank card) This is really not cheap... but giving my wife a nice Christmas break makes it worth every penny.
Hu Duo and his wife enjoyed a delightful holiday, but they were completely unaware of the murder that happened at the ski resort. The case remained unsolved due to a lack of crucial evidence.
Give it a try, what if it works? There's nothing to lose.

Back in school, I could never even guess right on a one-in-four multiple choice question. How am I supposed to win a lottery with such low odds? I'll just pick a suitable route myself; without hoping for luck, I won't fall for any scams!
Young man, why don't you check out the other travel routes? Christmas is peak travel season, and if you don't book a package soon, there won't be any tickets left!
Boss, I'll go for this island getaway for two. In winter, it's better to head somewhere warmer. If it's too cold, going out is such a chore.

Three days later, Hu Duo returned to work, and heard from colleagues that there was a murder at the Huadeshuang Ski Resort on Christmas Day. Unfortunately, due to lack of clues, the perpetrator could not be identified, leaving it as a cold case.
